question: 1. Which of these best describes an array?

answers.a: A data structure that shows a hierarchical behaviour
answers.b: Container of objects of similar types
answers.c: Container of objects of mixed types

question: 2. What is the time complexity of insertion at any point in an array?
3. Which of the following is an incorrect declaration of a one-dimensional array?
4. In a singly-linked list, each node contains a minimum of two fields. If one field is the data field to store the data, then the second field is _______.
5. What would be the asymptotic time complexity to add a tail element and to find an element in the linked list?
6. Why do we need pointers in a linked list but not in an array?

answers.a: Linked list can store any type of data
answers.b: Data is not stored in contiguous locations in linked list
answers.c: Array can only store elements of same type of data
